magpie.attributes.selectors

Class BestIndividualSelector

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.attributes.selectors.BaseAttributeSelector
      • magpie.attributes.selectors.BestIndividualSelector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Commandable, Options, Printable

    public class BestIndividualSelector
extends BaseAttributeSelector
    Selects attributes based on their individual performance. User defines a BaseAttributeEvaluator to rank the power of each individual, and how many of the top attributes by that metric to select. As this class does not consider the collective predictive power of a set of attributes, it may select attributes that correlate with each other. It is recommended that you only used this to select a single attribute.

    Usage: <number> <method> [<options...>]
    number: Number of top-performing attributes to select
    method: Name of a BaseAttributeEvaluator class used to rank attributes. ("?" to print available options)
    options...: Options for the attribute evaluator (unique to each method)

    See Also:
    BaseAttributeEvaluator, Serialized Form
